data.formatted_address: 28VR+FF6, Longhua District, Haikou, Haikou, Hainan, China, 570208
data.name: Haikou arcaded streets

reviews.text: A pedestrian street located in the capital city of Hainan Province. Reputedly built by early immigrants to Singapore and Malaysia, these old buildings which resemble those along Jalan Besar and Chinatown, have been mostly refurbished and now serves as shop lots selling Hainan foodstuff and memorabilia.
I loved this street with the old buildings that reminds of European old cities and the many statues. The market is very busy n loud.

Qilou Old Street

Very unique architecture with lots of shopping. Less place to sit unless you patron the restaurants. Recommended food is the salt baked chicken with congee.

Nearby this area, there is a fresh seafood market on the whole stretch of the street. It is smelled of fresh seafood and you can easily spot it.
Nice to walk… many shops and can take cute picture
historical building converted to the shopping I got some nice “tiger eye” bracelet with a really good price. I bumped into a hidden Mazu temple. The goddess for the fisherman and sailor.

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, San Ya Shi, Ji Yang Qu, 鹿岭路 邮政编码: 572004
data.name: Luhuitou Park

reviews.text: A famous park based on the fable of the Deer  Fairy and the Hunter. Quite the climb uphill after taking a buggy to mid hills. But the view at the top is very rewarding. Best times to come would be spring, autumn and winter seasons as the summers here are quite stifling hot. But the hordes of tourists also correspondingly thins out.

Great place to be visited for tourist or local. Nice scenery from above the hill. Best way to walk or ride a bus from entrance gate.
You can easy walk, brisk walk, and enjoy the view.
So many shopping stall so no need to worry about drink / food.
One of the great tourist spot in Sanya, Hainan.

Luhuitou Park is amazing, you can view the Sanya city scenery especially if you visit there in the night, you will see famous building landmark with different lights and the beautiful city. Definitely a place must visit in Sanya.
There was supposed to be a deer park and monkeys hanging around. See nothing of these two creatures, but a good view of the mariners.
Nice scenery, good for family, couple and single traveller. A lot of nice cafe with good view. Recommended.

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, Hai Kou Shi, Mei Lan Qu, Bo'ai Roadarea 邮政编码: 570208
data.name: Haikou Clock Tower

reviews.text: I came to the Haikou Clock Tower only because it's a famous landmark that's near Qilou Old Street where I was visiting. A tower is still just a tower, clock or no clock. There's a plaque that tells the history and that's about all. As it's located next to the river, it's a nice stroll along the esplanade. I assume it'll be nicer when it's lighted up at night esp when it's cooler. Had to fight the traffic to cross the big Changdi Road though. 😄
It’s in a very central location, you won’t miss it. That’s a start of a nice long stroll that you can do in both sides of the river.
Clock tower opposite Qilou Old Street. There is one bus stop here
The landmark of Haikou, just opposite Qilou Old Street

data.formatted_address: 28C6+G22, Jin Long Heng Lu, Long Hua Qu, Hai Kou Shi, Hai Nan Sheng, China, 570105
data.name: Xiuying Fort

reviews.text: fairly protected

In 1985, the Haikou Municipal People's Government announced it as a municipal key cultural relics protection unit. In 2006, it was announced as the sixth batch of national key cultural relics protection units. Xiuying Fort, together with Humen Fort in Guangdong, Wusong Fort in Shanghai, and Dagu Fort in Tianjin, are known as the four major forts in ancient China.

The Xiuying Fort was built in the 17th year of the reign of Emperor Guangxu of the Qing Dynasty (1891). It is located in Xiuying Village, Haixiu Avenue, southeast of Xiuying Port District, Haikou City. It is a grand military facility in ancient Hainan.
Liu Ming

Loved the time spend there
One of the best beaches in Sanya! Clean water, fine granulated sand, Amazing Evening! Must visit beach if travel to Sanya! Beautiful Sanya! Beautiful China!

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, Dan Zhou Shi, 中和镇 邮政编码: 571747
data.name: Dongpo Academy

reviews.text:
Song Dynasty poet and scholar Su Dong Po was banished from court by the emperor 3 times in his life. Hainan island was his last banishment. One of the first things he did as he gained recognition in the local community was to set up this school. Today it is a park, to remember his poems and his contributions to Hainan.

Great place to spend half a day.
Great place

Historical place, academy hero of his time.
Passionate about teaching education to the people of that era. Salute...
The cultural heritage is good, but the more we build, the more we feel like we are making money! When you go, don’t choose to go in summer, it’s hot, hot, hot! There will be surprises in winter! ! !
nice environment

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, San Ya Shi, Ya Zhou Qu, 崖城 邮政编码: 572024
data.name: Nanshan Daxiaodongtian

reviews.text: Very scenic tropical park with incredible views
Subtropical rainforest~coconut trees, beach, place for wedding photos

An extraordinary place. At the very entrance to the park we were met by a cobra; it was lying on the road and we had to wait for it to crawl away. We had a good guide and told us in detail about every stone, leaf and cave, it was a very exciting excursion. I really liked the legend about the dragon.  And what huge stones lie on the coast, they say they keep all the evil. Be sure to visit this center!
The scenery is beautiful and worth it😍😍😍
It's a pretty nice scenic spot, worth visiting.

data.formatted_address: Aft, Tagore Dr, Thomson Nature Park, Singapore
data.name: Hainan Village

reviews.text: The trail is shaded and not too long or tedious. One can complete the trail within an hour. There are different routes and alot of flora to see. You may encounter large monitor lizards if you are lucky. The amenities in the Thomson Nature Park are alright too, clean washrooms and a water cooler at the carpark area. The remains of the Hainan Village are scattered and not too many. One can still spot the washroom and some pots and pans.
Nice place for small nature area of the former Hainan village. Just be very careful as the road are very slippery. Especially after the rain.

The Hainanese abandoned village is located in the newly opened Thomson Nature Park. A true attraction as the 5 trails lead us to the old village houses where ruins, mostly covered by the forest can be seen.
The village was established around 1900 by people coming from Hainan. Some started farming and others worked as laborer's in various trades. The remaining ruins we can see are more from the 1930's and it was abandoned around 1970. A rare site of Singapore history not to be missed.

The village ruins are located in Thomson Nature Park. Short walk from the park entrant and easily accessible. You could see the stairs to house, walls and even cooking stove for pigs. Cooling trail as it is mostly shaded by trees.
The memories of Hainan village. old pots and vase seen on site. Walls still intact

reviews.text: Good old school amusement park. Ferris wheel, wildmouse, pirate ship, log race, dodgems. Buy a stored value card for 5RMB and then add money to the card. Rides are between 15 and 25RMB.

Great ecological environment. Close to ocean.

Riding a bicycle in the park is very relaxing
When walking barefoot on the beach, be careful about sharp objects that are not thrown into the trash can.

data.formatted_address: 76V3+83H, Yazhou District, Sanya, Hainan, China, 572024
data.name: Nanshan Buddhist Cultural Garden

reviews.text: This is definitely a place to visit even if you are not a Buddhist. Goddess of mercy is compassionate and love everyone. Goddess of mercy standing at three different direction overlooking the South China Sea and Hainan island. You will feel blessed. 🙏🙏🙏

please bring your water extra 😂😂
And make sure your shoes is comfortable for walking 😂😂😂

some area (in temple) is prohibited for cameras, please kindly follow the rules ya. Not every moment could be snap by camera but by your eyes and memories

Very  touching place. Wisdom and good spirit  just  get you straight to the heart of this  place.  100m tall Buddha  statue. Everything  has been prepared for visitors on the  enormous scale. Everything is in place. Restaurants , gardens where there are more  space and quiet  areas  to reflect.  Toilets, tourist police, and  ATM machines are all well described and  signed.  Without the Chinese language, it's  possible   to go through easily. Massive  car park in place. Place  must be seen  while  visiting  this island.
Clothes
Before  visiting, it's  worth checking the weather forecast.  Sunglasses,  hat, and  good  suncream  will be a good idea to  have with you. While sunny day  sandals or  flip-flops they are  fine. It's an easy  walk on the main alley that takes  to Monument . Raining windy weather, please  consider  appropriate clothes and protective shoes and clothes. Please  remember that the Monument is situated  about  500 m  on  the sea.
Ticket
Avaliable to  buy while  you  pass  security  checks at the main desk. There are a few  counters  open . Payments are accepted by cash or wechatpay.  Adult tickets  cost  about 15 USD.
Security
Passport or  your nationality ID  card  are necessary to get  through. Without it, it is not possible to let  you  in. You may bring  your  own food and  drinks, metal  flask  fine  for  x Ray hand or back pack checking.  Drones are strictly  not allowed to fly. International  Airport  nearby.
Toilets
Number  of Toilets. They are  clean and well maintained. However, remember to   pinch  paper from the main toilet  roll dispensers by  main door.  Disability toilets are in place, too.
Food and  drinks
There's lot  of small vendors selling food and hot and cold drinks.  Small  restaurants serve mainly  Chinese cuisine. They are very clean and mostly  have pictures with food.  Please   ask them  before ordering anything that they  will accept  payment by  cash if  you  don't have any electronic option to pay.
Smoking
There are designated areas  for  smoking.
Children
A lot  of  families are visiting places  with children. A lot  of  parts  have been  designed for  children.  Train,animals ,  playground, etc.
Safety
No concerns.  Police  officers are  by main points  such  exit gate, crossroads, etc.  Place very well monitored by ccctv.
Time
Best  planing to visit as early as  possible. Whole place is over  5 hectares areas, so  Lot of to walk and see.
Recommended.

A must-see if visiting Sanya. Admission tickets for adults is ￥129 and free for senior citizens. Expect lots of walking and staircase climbing so elderly have to be mentally prepared especially if intend to go all the way up to touch the 观音菩萨 feet.
The place is very beautiful and lot of visitors. The place have a good transport to transfer visitors to the Goddess of Mercy Statue. The queueing system is excellent.

data.formatted_address: 39 Qiu Hai Da Dao, Long Hua Qu, Hai Kou Shi, Hai Nan Sheng, China, 570311
data.name: The tomb of Hairui

reviews.text:
Peaceful spot to take a breath and a walk in the city.
I see a lor of people with histoeical issues in the cimments, but the space itself is lovely.
Nice place for a walk.

The tomb of Hai Rui was built in Hainan in the 17th year of Wanli reign of the Ming Dynasty (AD 1589), and it has a history of more than 400 years. The cemetery is rectangular in shape, facing south and covering an area of ​​15 acres with a construction area of ​​1,000 square meters. The main tomb is made of granite, with a height of 3 meters and a diameter of 3 meters. It is round at the top and octagonal at the bottom. It is divided into four floors and is octagonal. It embodies the saying that the sky is round and the place is in all directions, which means that Hai Rui's moral character coexists with heaven and earth, and the spread of Hai Rui's spirit In all directions of the land of China. The tombstone is 3 meters high, 0.88 meters wide and 0.36 meters thick. It is engraved with the following inscription: "The emperor of the Ming Dynasty ordered the burial of the good doctor Zhongjie Haigong in the tomb of the Youdu Yushi of the Nanjing Metropolitan Procuratorate. He gave the posthumous title of Prince Shaobao to Zhongjie Haigong." The cemetery passage is paved with granite slabs, with stone wengzhong, stone turtles, stone lions, stone horses and stone sheep arranged symmetrically on both sides. The main entrance is a stone archway of "Guangdong Zhengqi" that is 4.5 meters high and 7 meters wide.

Hai Rui
Hai Rui may not be that outstanding either. He is indeed an upright official, but he has done nothing practical. These noble figures in history place too much emphasis on reputation. If you only think about leaving a name for the ages, you will inevitably go to extremes sometimes. Our country now not only needs officials who dare to speak, but also officials who are willing to actually do things. Only through hard work can a country prosper! "
There are only two categories of officials, namely, capable officials and mediocre officials. If an upright official only has virtue but no ability, he is just a mediocre official. How can he rejuvenate the country? Since ancient times, are there many examples of so-called upright officials harming the country? Even if a corrupt official has shortcomings in character, as long as he has the ability to benefit the people, he is considered a competent official. How can he harm the country? Of those famous and virtuous ministers in the past dynasties, which one is truly upright? "
An honest official may not necessarily be a good official. What the people need is good officials, but not necessarily honest officials. For the common people, a good official is one who can actually consider their interests. As for an upright official, whether he is honest or not is his own business. However, whether he can serve the common people is related to millions of common people. real benefits. If an official is only honest, but does not do anything for the people, and only cares about his own reputation, what is the use of it?
It was destroyed by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution in 1966 and became a pigsty for a time. The existing one was repaired by the people voluntarily after the reform and opening up...

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, Bao Ting Li Zu Miao Zu Zi Zhi Xian, 224国道9MX6+29H 邮政编码: 572317

reviews.text: We have a love tour guide Ah Mei. She explained very well in Mandarin.

It is a good place to know that how they had  been living at Binglang.
You may take over than 4hour in order to see that all.
Do not miss the chance to visit Binglang.

A huge ethnographic park dedicated to the indigenous peoples of Li and Miao, the park is huge, I couldn’t get around it on foot in 3 hours. I advise you to take a train. After a walk in the park I went to the Show. I write the show with a capital letter, it really is a show, with performances and animals that involve the audience.

In the AAAAA National Scenic Area, there are betel nuts everywhere, as well as ethnic minority cultures and large-scale multi-person performances. The tour guide will finally sell the product "Feng Xiao Da".
The air is very good and there are great Li cultural performances!

data.formatted_address: 298H+9JP, Guo Xing Da Dao, Qiong Shan Qu, Hai Kou Shi, Hai Nan Sheng, China, 571100
data.name: Hainan Museum

reviews.text:
Exhibits spans over 3 levels. Each theme occupies 1 level and covers an area of 3 exhibition halls per level. Quite easy to navigate on our own. There was free interpretation service at fixed timing but we didn't opt for those.

Entry is free, but the entry itself was a bit of a hassle, scanned both wechat and alipay but didn't seem to work. Ended up the counter service did manual enrollment.
nice to walk… free entry… very big…. nice architecture….. everything is just worth my taxi ride to here!

If you search for the laws of harmony, you will find knowledge, I love going to the Museums cause there's always a room for discovery. “History doesn’t repeat itself, but it does rhyme." Friends must visit this place, mostly buses has a stop in front of Hainan Mseum. “The philosophy I love is very selective. The more art I see, the more I learn to define my own taste. Here, I learned that everything flows, nothing abides, everything gives way and nothing stays fixed. That's why I love the name of honour, more than I fear death." 'Love-Hainan-Museum'
Came here as part of a city tour. Exhibits were not very steeped in history but the whole set up was new, clean and alot of multimedia.
Free entry, closed on Mondays

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, San Ya Shi, Ji Yang Qu, 海口市 邮政编码: 572004
data.name: Luhuitou Peak Park

reviews.text:
This park is relatively cheap to visit but you will need to pay separately for the small bus/buggy to take you to the mid level unless you want to walk.

Once further up, you'll be presented with some great views of Sanya city, the beach and Phoenix island.  The central attraction will be the huge statue of the deer which has a love story behind  it.

There is a slide at the top but you may feel it's not worth the asking price.  You'll probably be better off taking a gentle stroll back down to catch the buggy back to the entrance/exit and enjoy the lush floral surroundings.  However, although very rare, do be aware there maybe snakes in the bushes.

The park is nicely designed and it offers a stunning view over Sanya. In the night it show's a beautiful colored light design.
You can bock a car-transfer to the top of the mountain, but I would recommend to walk, because the way up offers beautiful views and good photo spots.

Well developed and organised tourist attraction that starts from the base and offers a paid buggy ride up the hill. But still need to walk a good 10 minutes before reaching the peak where the statue is.
It was supposed to be a place to enjoy sunset but we missed that part lol. City and ocean view is still worth it.
Amazing view! Some frogs and monkeys are around the park :)

data.formatted_address: 28M8+F9V, Lv Yuan Zhong Lu, Long Hua Qu, Hai Kou Shi, Hai Nan Sheng, China, 570125
data.name: 万绿园

reviews.text: I loveeeeee it!!! I could spend days not not just hours there!! It’s amazing both on day and night times!! Take your time there and enjoy!!

Nice park, still have some renovation going on at west side of the park. Good for jogging and fresh air right opposite our hotel (Baohua Harbour View Hotel).

Many buses starts and ends here, very convenient as it reaches to many places that we wishes to go (volcano geopark, haikou movie town etc).

Long stretch of bridge and can see Century Bridge from here. There are many eatery stalls and funfair here.

Overall, recommended for a nice evening walk and jog
Excellent park with seaview and plenty of greenery. Has got exercise areas and equipment. Located downtown Haikou. Luxurious business hotels and office buildings across the road opposite the park .
Definitely worth visiting if you are staying in haikou for more than a day. It's also connected to the haikou bayside greenway, where locals enjoy their evening walks most.

The Evergreen park is a great place for getting your running done. There's also a kid's entertainment area with a few rides, old school gym equipment and various tiled areas where locals organise their nightly/weekly dance classes. It's also the best place to set out your picnic blanket and watch the nightly light show on the building across the street.

data.formatted_address: 3829+6V5, Shiji Brg, Meilan District, Haikou, Hainan, China, 570228
data.name: Haikou Century Bridge

reviews.text: It is a big bridge but the best part is the walking paths around that gets to the bridge and not really the bridge, I liked the fact that they are using the space under the bridge for basketball courts!
Really beautiful, worth seeing
Outstanding view at night.
Ok!
State of the Art.

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, San Ya Shi, Ji Yang Qu, 亚龙湾国家旅游度假区 邮政编码: 572011
data.name: The Ritz Carlton Sanya

reviews.text:
We had a good time here. We were lucky to have the room upgraded.
1. Employee: The hotel staff are super friendly and helpful.
2. Dining: Breakfast buffet was pretty good too. Many dining options. But if you want the hot pot by the sea, you need to have reservations.
3. Location: The beach is connected to the hotel. It’s next to the Hilton’s resort area. The pools are everywhere in between the buildings. Easy to have fun. 15 mins walk to the authentic food court of Yalong Bay Area.

Only thing to complain was that people love smoking… but most of the resort area is smoke free, and the staff are working hard to stop the smoking behavior in public.

I highly recommend and would definitely love to come back again.
Hi, it wasn't that of a fine experience from us. The rooms were good but the service was only mediocre

We had such a wonderful time staying at Ritz Carlton Sanya celebrating 15 happy years of Love and Romance together. It was our first time visiting Sanya. After researching through Google and TripAdvisor reviews, we decided to have our special anniversary trip at RC Sanya.

As an Ambassor Elite member of Bonvoy, we were welcomed with warm and kind gestures from complimentary pick up from the airport, a designated personal butler services, sweet in room decorations welcoming us and on our special day with bottles of sparkling wines, flowers, cake, balloons, daily fresh whole fruits and fresh coconuts, attentive housekeeping team, daily F&B credit, spa treat and manymore.

We booked the garden pool villa hoping to be upgraded to the beachfront villa. Unfortunately, we did not get any luck this time. Haha. The entire property looked bit tired and less appealing.... we were kind of worried when we reached the hotel lobby... But then our impressions changed almost immediately when we stepped into our villa, it's well maintained, all the electrical appliances were up to date and practical, large screen TV's, automatic toilet seat (one of the best thoughtful designs I've ever used), USB cable friendly at every corner of the rooms, Nespresso machine... The huge and deep bathtub was a big plus! 👍❤️ How we wished we could stay here when doing several times of Hotel mandatory quarantine during the past 3 years of pandemic. 😆

Now we would like to highlight the most important assets of RC Sanya, the people! 👏😍♥️ Oliver, our personal butler, who would go all the extra miles to make us happy. He jotted down all our likes and dislikes when checking us in, and shared some special info's like our special diet to F&B chef's and team. Shirley the manager, Frank, Chef Tom from Pearl Restaurant and Chef Andy from Sofia Italian restaurant did a marvellous job in accommodating our preferences especially when one of us was suffering from tummy flu before going to Sanya. Zoe, who helped us getting medical consultation and medicines. And also not to forget Jilly, Viky and the breakfast team at Sand Grill and Bar. Everyone was just too kind enough to tailor something for us out of the menu throughout our stay, we were truly grateful for all the efforts extended to us. 🙏😍♥️ Our spa masseuse ladies Lily and Amy, thank you for pampering us with your skillful hands. Chen Xiang Li  and Carry from housekeeping team had made our stay amazingly comfortable. They're extremely hardworking, always with smiling faces wherever we met them. As frequent travellers, we usually don't encourage daily make up rooms as we find it's not necessary plus not environmentally friendly. Somehow I just kind of looking forward to the room being dressed by Xiang Li and Carry, their attetion to details, the neat and tidiness of displaying guest's personal items were just beyond 5 stars service!

We also enjoyed some of our nights listening to live bands performed by Leon and Walds at Sand Grill. They could really sing chinese songs too! It would be even better if the bands could sing little longer than 21:30? That's a shame to leave guest's moods hanging when the night is still young. 🤭😅

Last but not least, our 'family' in Sanya, Quan who was being appointed to drive us around Sanya. Since it's a 8 hours long day trip, we invited Quan to join us along while sightseeing and dinner together, we feel that would be more considerate than just letting him wait for us in the car all day. In fact, I think Quan enjoyed as much as we did and we have shared some of our family histories towards the end of the day.

Thank you once again for making our 15th anniversary a memorable one! Hats off to each and everyone whom we have met at RC Sanya!

Fantastic hotel with the biggest and nicest pools I have ever seen! It has a relatively small beach front, but it's well maintained and clean. Perfect place for both adults and kids. The only downside is maybe the location, outside the hotel area not much happening, but it's easy to get a taxi and visit nearby eating and shopping places. And again, those amazing pools compensate for everything! :)

This is a 1st class hotel, worthy of a five star rating and even repeat visits. Located directly on the beach of the Yalong Bay, this cozy resort has essentially everything you could want. From delicious wagyu steak at their local Italian restaurant to a great little movie theater, to watch the most recent blockbuster, the resort has it all. The views from the pools and rooms are incredible. A picturesque scene of mountains and ocean in the backdrop to the gorgeous property full of coconut trees and flowers. All of the staff go out of their way to ensure each guest is appreciated and feels welcomed. If you're not a local Chinese guest, feel free to book a driver from the airport directly through the hotel. It takes away all of the concerns of translations. Once you are at the resort, the staff will help you get anywhere you want by easy taxi services. This resort is a slice of paradise and it is a great home base for all sorts of available tourism in Hainan.

data.formatted_address: Phoenix Island, Tianya District, Sanya, China, 572000
data.name: Phoenix Island

reviews.text: A pretty hotel with gorgeous views! Rooms are spacious. It is right on the bay and the hotel offers transfer cars to get to the  SanYa city. It is a little bit of old and outdated but the view is worth it!
Amazing holiday location with stunning views.

Phoenix Island (simplified Chinese: 凤凰岛; traditional Chinese: 鳳凰島; pinyin: Fènghuáng Dǎo), dubbed the Oriental Dubai,] is an artificial archipelago consisting of two landmasses forming an island resort in Sanya, Hainan Province, China.
Important for the world
Very rude local people, too crowded, dirty sea, nice view

data.formatted_address: 12 Yuhai Road, 吉阳区三亚市海南省 China, 572000
data.name: Mandarin Oriental, Sanya

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel. Always a fan of MO. The moment you enter, the lovely signature smell. Great rooms, great staff, great pool. Great views over the beach, all you can ask for from a resort.

The snorkelling was great. Our 2 year old son loved playing in the sand and the pool. The independent house was nice with it's own pool and was close to the beach with snorkelling close. Snorkelling had beautiful fish and quite a bit of coral in the snorkelling area. Having our own small pool at the house was nicer than I thought it would be. The breakfast was great even with my food sensitivities (wheat/gluten, dairy, and egg). The pastries looked delicious haha. They have mango that is wonderful, you just have to ask the fruit table person to cut some for you. The main pool was huge and beautiful with very few people and a small waterslide (was out of service when we went).

Service was great too. I wouldn't know how easy it is if you only know English since my wife did most of the talking in chinese. I know at least one of the workers there at the drop off area was fluent in English and all of the signs had English too.

Nice view here. And this property has a provide bay that you could have dinner with awesome coastal view. What’s more, there are lots of shell close to the beach. Sooooo interesting! And hotel has nice pools and face to the see. Good to take photos.

I was so looking forward to my stay this time after pandemic … but obviously the new management does not understand the concept of Mandarin Oriental hotel..

We were greeted by a greasy Smokey smell permeated in the air instead of floral scents from nature that we have remembered… there is barbecue buffet on the beach ! Wow , what a turn off scene ! I think the old manager will be furious to see that !

If you are looking for a serene , above and beyond experience, do not book here!

Wonderful experience. A real luxury experience.
Beautiful resort (gardens, swimming pools, amazing rooms with views), and super nice and professional staff, always smiling, polite, and asking if they could do something for us. We could totally rest and relax.
we had a great time.
The only "bad" things: the beach has a lot of rocks so it's difficult to go in the water, quite dangerous.
the restaurant "fresh" has good food but clearly overpriced. It's more expensive than top restaurant in Shanghai with much higher quality.
But even though, that didn't impact our beautiful trip.

data.formatted_address: Yalong Bay National District, 6JHG+R4V吉阳区三亚市海南省 China, 572000
data.name: Sanya Marriott Yalong Bay Resort & Spa

reviews.text: Internet speed is very slow. It was a big problem for me. Almost No one speaks English.
Marriot Hotel in sanya Yalong bay, is a ideal place to stay in sanya. Very nice and very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel offers alot of recreation activities.
One of the best otel in Sanya Hainan

Good family hotel great for kids good sized rooms friendly staff. But buffet leaves a lot to be desired
Good atmosphere.
Incredible and awesome hotel and staff! Most speak excellent English. Great breakfast and a wow to Their Fish Bar!

data.formatted_address: No. 39 Yangshan Boulevard, 龙华区海口市 China, 571155
data.name: Renaissance Haikou Hotel

reviews.text: Perfect and very organized. The food in the morning for breakfast is worth the price of the room alone. You can imagine having every possible thing you could ever desire put out for you to eat then this is the place. Everything you could ever want is at your beck and call and they have plenty of staff to help you. Grab your table and somebody will bring you milk coffee and whatever else you desire why you go to the buffet and pick out your food. Nothing but happiness

Hotel was near the golf course and outlet mall. Food was plentiful . The Haikou international airport was a mere 20 minute drive away. Rooms were good and tastefully furnished. Service was good too. Overall a good stay.

Nice view of Mission Hill Golf Course.
The guest room was great with full amenities.
Many choices for Breakfast.
The location is not so close to city.

I would like to say a BIG THANKYOU to Renaissance Haikou Hotel. I am a repeat customer to the hotel and every time I have an enjoyable stay. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. In particular, special thanks to Shirley Li for being very accommodating. I would definitely give 5 stars in all categories and will return again soon.

Clean and very well kept hotel. Staff are very friendly. If you are staying at the hotel they were offering 50% discount on the hotpot buffet, too. Breakfast spread selection was good, food was decent. Excellent views at night and big rooms. Location would be a problem if you are planning to visit the city.

data.formatted_address: 28 Hai Tang Bei Lu, Hai Tang Qu, San Ya Shi, Hai Nan Sheng, China, 572014
data.name: Sofitel Sanya Leeman Resort

reviews.text:
Sadly this resort is 2 stars worth, and expect your self to feel scammed.
The location and the place are really nice, however there is no aircon in the lobby and the mall, room aircon is Banana and it will needs to run for 5 hours to cool the room, the Internet is not safe here since they filter all the data through the server for data collection and use them for third party, besides that I called them many times about the Internet was so slow and they keep telling me they will ask the technicians to increase the speed.
Expect silly shows like they walk slowly to light candles and things like that, they charge for everything here so nothing is free, I had to pay many extra fees, the buffet was very limited when it comes to food, they have some low budget performances for kids so don't expect much here.
Expect them to cut your Internet when you use the VPN and I give-up doing some work since you don't have privacy when you use thier Internet.
They have game room and race track but the cars are made for kids only and the prices are very expensive here.
The hotel employees are very nice and struggle to help since the top managements are super low budget.

If you are not Chinese don't stay here.

The Hotel runs false promotions via third parties and charges you weeks later. The Hotelmanager does not respond to any sort of mail and you are left waiting. For a Sofitel this resort Is not up to the international standard.

Beautiful hotel and service BUT was extremely extremely disappointed with the security standards there!
I attended a family member wedding ceremony there and brought some of our expensive liquor there to be served during the wedding reception. A very expensive bottle of liquor was stolen!
We collected some wedding gifts in cash and my wife kept it in her handbag during the dinner. During the dinner, she has to go out to collect food from the buffet dinner and the wedding gifts were stolen!
The hotel couldn't do much or that I have observed they tried hard to help us.
We do not expect such a low level of security standard for such a so called 'good' hotel.
If you do go and stay there. Guard your valuables with your life!

Wonderful resort with a private access to the beach. Loved the lobby; the room was clean and spacious; balcony was huge with an open view of the resort and the beach; the staffs were very professional and helpful. Enjoyed my helicopter ride with my family. Absolutely enjoyed my stay there. Will definitely be back!

What a wonderful hotel experience. Amazing. This hotel is simply awesome!

Sanya is an undiscovered gem for the western market, but go in low season (Apr-Oct) and you won't be disappointed.

Firstly, this property is HUGE! Don't let that put you off. It just means you can find a corner of it to suit you.

Taxi to/from Sanya Airport is about 140-150 CNY and 45 minutes. Atlantis Water Park is well worth a visit and ten minutes taxi from the Sofitel.

Rooms here are beautiful! So well-appointed and maintained. Beautiful views from my room, huge bath and that amazing Sofitel bed.

4 swimming pools to choose from and the main pool features a swim-up bar.

Lots of facilities for families and couples alike, and the place is large enough that you won't be annoyed by a different demographic to you.

Food and Beverage is excellent for both Asian and western cuisine. Breakfast is a massive offering with something for everyone. Amazing fresh-baked bread every morning is sensational.

The Club Lounge is an oasis of calm and a lovely place to enjoy breakfast or evening cocktails and canapes if you are able to gain entry due to Accor status or room type.

The staff are great here and well trained. The service staff have enough English to cover their roles and they are so sincere with their efforts to please you. I have to say Carrie, Lisa and Amy in the bar were excellent and very obliging.

Also, Alice Chen as Manager of The Club was exceptional at her job. She is charming, caring and has her guests' comfort and experience as a priority all the time. Nothing is too much trouble for her. She is a super star.

Finally, F&B Manager, Adam, is one of the nicest people you could hope to meet. He stopped by every day to chat, get feedback and offer suggestions. He's a huge asset to the team here and is brilliant at his job.

As a Platinum Accor Plus member, I stay over 70 nights per year in Accor Hotels worldwide. I would put this property in my "Top 3" without any hesitation. It is all about good facilities, good food and beverage and the guest experience. This hotel excels in all three. You can tell its an exceptionally well-run property where staff go "above and beyond" to make sure guests have a wonderful stay.

I was very sad to leave and will definitely come back. It's truly wonderful here.

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, San Ya Shi, Tian Ya Qu, 三亚湾路188号 邮政编码: 572000
data.name: Howard Johnson Resort Sanya Bay

reviews.text: I had stayed at Howard Johnson for 5 days as a chaperon of school trip. The hotel was beautiful, clean and well maintained. The best part of this hotel were staff members, they were extraordinary kind and helpful.  I am used to be one of very demanding and high maintenance guest even 5 stars there were little attitude for annoying guest;) but there I never got any attitude but a willful helping hand.  The highlight was I lost my iphone at last moment of my departure. I track my phone at the hotel however I ran out of time, had to  leave to Shanghai without my phone. I speak no Mandarin, tried to call or e-mail but couldn't reach to hotel, it was very struggling myself, then my home phone rang from those one of nice hotel receptionist, Nancy, fortunately she spoke almost perfect English, she had helped me for 3 hours to figure out how to send my phone back to Shanghai. Use hotel phone, my home phone, my spouse contact, back and forth, that was such complicated situation especially I could not explain my address in Mandarin, she could dump away this to our trip guide who could not reach at the moment. She made couple clever ideas, helped me right away. I really appreciate for this help also how she  was willing to stepped in my trouble. Thank you so much!!

Hotel was nice. They do not have much English speaking staff. Were not able to help me with usb power adapter. Not able to exchange currency because my bills were old. Breakfast buffet was very good and the pool, pond with fish to eat your dead skin, spa was nice.
TOP Resort very close to the beach of Sanya in a tropical garden.  Nice and clean rooms with terrace and View to ocean and garden. Breakfast is good, also for guests from europe.

Number. We had a Suite. This is a superior room with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a huge living room and an equally huge balcony. The view from our room was Ocean View (sea view). On my YouTube channel (UlyanaSilina) there is a detailed review of the SUITE room at the Howard Johnson Resort Sanya Bay 5* from 2023. Housekeeping was done every day and everything was very clean. They don't take tips in China, they're afraid. One day, we caught a cleaner (a young guy) and directly and urgently gave him a Kazakhstani chocolate bar in gratitude.

Hotel area. The hotel itself, like the building, and its territory are huge. There is a place to walk, sit and relax. The hotel is divided into two wings: western and eastern. There are 3 swimming pools on the territory, but during our stay only one was working - the central one, but it was quite enough for all hotel guests. The pool (November 2023) was not heated. But the air temperature was 28 degrees Celsius. Near the central pool there is a jacuzzi with Garra rufa fish (peeling fish), 50 yuan for a 30-minute procedure. There is also a BBQ restaurant and a Korean restaurant on site. We have not been to any of these restaurants, because... The prices seemed expensive to us. We went outside the hotel for lunch and dinner. On my YouTube channel (UlyanaSilina) there is a detailed review of the Howard Johnson Resort Sanya Bay 5* hotel from 2023.

Infrastructure near the hotel. Not far from the hotel, literally 200 meters from its main entrance, there is a Phoenix seafood square and a food court. We ate there. The prices are reasonable: 20-30 yuan for a huge portion of Chinese noodle soup. There are MacDonalds and KFC. There are also many shops and boutiques with things near the hotel. There is a large supermarket where we bought beer, sweets, and fruit. On my YouTube channel there is a video about this supermarket, where I show the assortment and prices as of November 2023, as well as shops and a food court next to the HoJoSy hotel. We also took a taxi several times to Dadonghai to the famous “12 Chairs” cafe to eat seafood.

We visited the sights of Hainan (Monkey Island, Nanshan Buddhism Center, Li and Mao village, “The Deer Turned its Head” park) by taxi, which stands right next to the main entrance to the hotel. But there is one caveat: when you take a taxi, you need to tell the driver Meter - this means that you will only go according to the meter. Otherwise, the taxi driver himself will tell you the cost of a one-way trip, which will be at least 50 yuan more expensive than according to the meter. As they say, a tourist who is not deceived is not a tourist ;)

Sea and beach. Let me immediately mention that there are no sunbeds or umbrellas on the beach! I don’t know what it was like here before the pandemic, but during our visit in November 2023 there was none of this. We took towels from the Towel Center (on the hotel grounds, by the central pool) and used them as bedding on the sand. The beach itself is clean. There aren't many people. The Chinese bathe almost never or rarely. The water in the South China Sea in November is like fresh milk, warm. But muddy due to the sandy bottom. This, of course, is not the Red Sea of ​​Egypt with its clear water and underwater world, but it is also very cool and useful... There were some water activities like hydro scooters and boats, but we did not use them, because... Everywhere there is a language barrier in misunderstanding of the language. Once we went specifically to the beach in Dadonghai Bay - there were, of course, many times more people there than in Sanya Bay. In general, Dadonghai is for a noisy holiday with a bunch of cafes, shops, shopping centers, and Sanya Bay is for a quiet and peaceful holiday.

We had to check out from the hotel on November 23, 2023 at 02:00 am. We came to the reception, handed over our room card and waited for the transfer. The deposit of 500 yuan was returned, there were no questions asked of us.

Excellent service, largely thanks to the guide Andrey (Ming) from Selfie travel, if it were possible we would give him all 10 stars. Breakfast is good, for citizens of different countries.

Cons - there are cockroaches, we didn’t see them in the room, only in the hallway and on the balcony

data.formatted_address: Wenchang, China, 571333
data.name: Hilton Wenchang

reviews.text: Very kid friendly. Hotel is on the older side but the staff is extremely welcoming and accommodating of children. Eva Zhang at the kids playground was very helpful. My daughters had a great time.

Decided to book this hotel as it was the closest 5-stars hotel to my in-law's ancestor village in Wenjiao village. It is near the beach but in a rather exclusive (secluded) enclave that's developed by the same developer LuNeng group. The whole hotel has a 航天 (China's equivalent of NASA) theme as the space station is situated here in Wenchang. Rooms are clean and condition is above average. Nice restaurants and prices are acceptable (comparing with Singapore).

Arrived 7am on the morning of the launch of Long March 5, hotel was fully booked for this momentous event and it was near impossible to be checked in early however Megan Chan at reception did all she could to get us a room and we ended up being checked in to a room within 30mins. Megan was amazing throughout our week long stay she assisted with every little thing we needed, though we could only speak minimal mandarin Megan tried her best to help us along the way. Had an amazing stay thanks to her, we will definitely be back again but is abit far away from the main tourist area. Jacky Chen at concierge was also great in making sure we were safe and always picked up and dropped off by the hotel shuttle. 2 amazing employees who did all they could to make our stay very pleasant. Rooms were very large, airy and comfortable. Food was also reasonably priced and of good quality. Thank you Megan and Jacky for a unforgettable stay.
Nice room but not really a 5 star breakfast.
Stay on 24.06.2018 : Truly 5star resort hotel, with private beach. Location out of city. Excellent bfast.

data.formatted_address: 43CM+F99, Changjiang Li Autonomous County, Hainan, China, 572723
data.name: Hainan Bawangling National Nature Reserve

reviews.text: It was raining on the day we went, so it didn't take long to climb the mountain. The air is very clean and cool.
The air is excellent, but everything else is just average.

data.formatted_address: CX2J+JWG, Lingshui Li Autonomous County, Hainan, China, 572426
data.name: Hainan Nanwan Provincial Nature Reserve

reviews.text: The park is worth a visit. The area is not very large, but it is enough for a walk. You need to be careful and keep an eye on things so that the monkeys don’t steal something, and aggressive individuals may also get caught. One aggressive monkey almost attacked me, but I didn’t move and she calmed down. You should also not touch animals, as this is fraught with consequences. I really didn't like the animal shows. There were them during the show and in general it looked as cruel as possible. If you are on the island, do not attend these performances, because there is nothing interesting there except the torment of animals.

data.formatted_address: M788+JXM, Wanning, Hainan, China, 571545
data.name: Hainan Qingpi Linsheng Ji Nature Reserve

reviews.text:
The most beautiful bay in Hainan - Shimei Bay. This is the filming location of the movie If You Are the One. The sea breeze is very comfortable.
There is also a very exquisite little bookstore next to it

The scenery of blue sea and white sand is beautiful, but there is always garbage seen along the road, which is a fly in the ointment.
The Fenghuang Jiuli Bookstore next to it is very easy to take pictures and very artistic.

reviews.author_name: 你家裡死人盜我帳號的
reviews.text: Experience nature, have food tastings, and see many beautiful plants along the way, as well as some plants you have never seen before. I recommend everyone to come.
The beach and bay are vast and clean, making it a tourist attraction worth visiting.
Joining the right group will take you to heaven, joining the wrong group will make you jealous

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, Hai Kou Shi, Xiu Ying Qu, 东山镇155县道Q7C3+HQV 邮政编码: 571154
data.name: Hainan Tropical Garden of Wild Fauna and Flora

reviews.text: The place is awesome and lots of fun.  Ride through with the bus and relax. Great place!
This place is absolutely gorgeous and worth it to go by yourself, with friend or family. During Chinese holidays it can be very crowded thought so I'd recommend going during the week if you can.

Nice park for both animals and plants. Part of the park is driven around in cars and you can admire the animals from the car window. There are areas where you walk and there is a small dino park where interactive models of dinosaurs are installed. The giants, lurking in the greenery near the paths, scream and open their mouths, the main thing is not to get scared. It is very pleasant to walk in the shade of trees, especially when it is very hot outside. There are toilets on site and, of course, small cafes with ice cream and drinks. Here you can have a great time on your day off. I recommend.

There are 2 pandas here! Interestingly, local residents do not know that there are pandas on Hainan Island! Entry by car is 139 yuan, animals (giraffes, elephants, crocodiles, etc.) can be fed for 10 yuan. The park is huge, so you need to allocate 3-4 hours plus travel to visit.

Nice zoo, well-groomed animals.
For the most part, you need to travel by car or by bus; animals are allowed out at bus stops.
The remaining part, the main characters of which are pandas, is walked.
One of the advantages is that elephants, giraffes, hippos and camels can be fed. Food for them is sold locally and is inexpensive.

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, Hai Kou Shi, Long Hua Qu, Hai Ken Lu, 海垦路 邮政编码: 570226
data.name: Jinniuling Park Zoo

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, Ding An Xian, 塔岭开发区 邮政编码: 571299
data.name: Hainan Tropical Birds World

reviews.text: It’s not bad to see all kinds of birds easily
It feels good to bring children to play~
Very ordinary park

data.formatted_address: Yazhou District, Sanya, China, 572024
data.name: 南山寺

reviews.text: Amazing place! The 3side guanying statue and the big temple is so magnificent, really big tourist area, recomended to buy the commuter ticket if you want to go to all the places cause its too big to finish in 1 day by walk. Have the giok stone shop, souvenirs, food tenant, the view also amazing with the blue ocean wide panoramic view, pagoda was closed at that time but the beach view around there is cool! You can pray, tie the red ribbon, throw the coins at the Gods pond, walk through the wood learn a lot of things there! Deff worth to try, if you can speak mandarin better buy the ticket on the spot, more cheaper than online thru the travel agent. Also recomend to use sunblock as the sun is really bright and I got tanned there 😂
The statue of Guanyin Goddess of Nanshan is magnificent! There is simply no way to describe the beauty of this place - you need to be there and feel it's energy and blessing! 🙏

It‘s a big and impressiv Park. You can go for Long and beautiful walks in the forest or along the beach.

The statue is very impressiv and beautiful.

You‘ll sadly notice that this place was built specially for tourists.
Sightseeing in Sanya, this Buddhist statue is famous for protecting the people and their lands. It is made of lots of precious stones and metals. Worth seeing if you are vacationing around here.

A pretty temple with big park. Guan Yin goddess is impressive.
Note that we can only the lift up to 3rd floor and have to use the stairs for another 2 floors.
It’s very breezy up there, might consider not wearing a dress or skirt. But a lot of areas are exposed under the sun, it’s good to have umbrella and sunglasses on a sunny day.
Can easily spend 2 to 3 hours there. I don’t think the shuttle is necessary, it’s quite a comfortable walk on nice flat path.
Don’t forget to roll the sutra wheels.

data.formatted_address: W89X+W57, Longhua District, Haikou, Haikou, Hainan, China, 571155
data.name: Guanlan Lake Huayi Feng Xiaogang Film Commune

reviews.text: A small movie town by famed director Feng Xiao Gang. Basically three movie sets in different eras. Most shops are closed during summer months.
Very nice building structures of different Asian themes. But it was very hot and humid so not a lot of people when we came over.

Highly recommended visit to this outdoor studio setting. Interactive play twice a day, buildings are similar to what u see on TV films and movies. There are also hotels which you can book for staying. Take a bus from Evergreen Park Bus Stn, direct bus to this movie town. Entry before 6pm is more expensive. Since we went in October, the halloween decoration doesnt really fit in the studio setting.
There is a noodle shop in Nanyang that is very delicious, highly recommended.
Love this place. It was not crowded and able to take nice photos

I'v watched many chinese movies. This is my first visit to China and the first time I this movie site (not sure they use this site for movie shot). But overall quite good experience. Good place to take pictures in chinese style. It is very hot weather and U might get sunburn (my visit in May), better prepare a cap or umbrella or just wear sun block to ur skin.

reviews.text: I was a bit disappointed as it looked a bit abandoned and the entrance fee was too high for that but there was live music, some old guys played traditional instruments which compensate my disappointment.

Temple of the Five Lords
Weather not too hot, there are performance when we went in. Direct bus from Evergreen Park Bus Station
A great place to visit to learn more history of China
Nice temple 👍🏻
Nice temple (several buildings) with quite some land, but almost everything is empty and some parts were closed. The museum inside the museum is not really interesting.

Great

data.name: Xinglong Tropical Botanical Garden

reviews.text: A must to visit while in Hainan island to learn about various tropical plants with their specialties of coffee and cacao products.

The place was just so so .... except for the coconut milk coffee, it's best place to shop coconut milk coffee. The coconut milk is tasted so good mixed with coffee.

Another kind of drinks mixed with coconut milk are chocolate, tea, and ginger. Since I'm a coffee lover, so I bought coconut milk coffee. It's recommended product to buy.

I was a tourist visiting this garden, came here by a group tour. They showed us many kinds of plants on their garden, such as pepper, coconut, and others.

Well, a bit a good place to release the stress.

So so. When i came here a few days ago, just  a little flowers that blossoms. The land is super big, we can use battery car to go around this place. The view behind this place is green hills and mountains, so beautiful. Maybe it will be pretty if i come here when spring.
Great places to take pictures and relax
Good,recommended place

reviews.text: Very clean beach. Nice medium sized white sand. Few Russians, mostly Chinese. There are many cafes and a grocery store near the beach.

Wonderful beach!!
Gorgeous beach, clear water!
Sanya is very cool, warm, beautiful, but very expensive.
Nice beach, clean sea, great!
Sanya, the iconic road, the air here is very good, the shadows of coconut trees. However, Sanya's health management is still not in place, and urban construction needs to be improved.

data.name: Yalongwan

data.formatted_address: Haitang Bay, Haitang District, Sanya, China, 572014
data.name: Haitang Bay

reviews.text: If Hainan is the Hawaii of China, then Sanya is definitely the Honolulu, which means beaches, hotels, and tropical weather. The hotels in Haitang area is brand new, and they are all luxury hotels. We stayed in Crown Plaza, which has a temp controlled boundless pool on the top floor which oversee the ocean. Just amazing!!!!
A lot of fancy hotels. It’s nice to take a walk on the beach. Not many restaurants, mainly those located in fancy hotels, which are rather expensive.

If you are looking to chilling and having a dip in the sea, then this is not the place for it. Local Authorities have ban Swimming in the sea. Death trolls was 5 till now. There is no lifeguard or any lounge area. It’s a quite beach. There is nothing much there except hotels. No water sports and food nearby too. The water isn’t clear either as compare to other beaches
Not bad
It's far away from downtown Sanya, but the sea water here is very clear.

data.formatted_address: 27F7+J3Q, Bin Hai Da Dao, Xiu Ying Qu, Hai Kou Shi, Hai Nan Sheng, China, 570314
data.name: Xixiu Beach Park

reviews.text: Beautiful place with a big area of boating park, secure, entertainment, fun, and so many other things are there, but I suggest to go only on Sunny Day, between 2 to 6pm and one thing more, plz take your food with you, there is only one cafe that's very expensive. Row boat, motor boat, sail boat are available for customers 150RMB to 450RMB per 20 minutes, So enjoy your life with the beauty of Nature....,
A wonderful place
Relaxing place, cool breeze, can walk and play. Paid parking is available. If you're in a hurry, come visit here. Then you will be fully charged. There are public restrooms as well.
Good for relax...Nice Beach👍 Good scenery and romantic beach👍👍👍

A tourist beach very close to the city. The beach faces north, with a high-density residential and commercial area on the right, and a seawall on the left, which slightly blocks the view. It is cleaner than Holiday Beach, there are few vendors or snacks nearby, and there are more residents than tourists. It is a good place for a walk on the seaside.

data.formatted_address: China, Hai Nan Sheng, Hai Kou Shi, Xiu Ying Qu, 142县道W6HC+7QM 邮政编码: 571152
data.name: Haikou Volcanic Cluster Global Geopark

reviews.text:
We took a didi to this location.
Number 1 must visit place in Haikou.
We came during their off peak season in June. Tickets are much cheaper.

Foreigners to buy tickets over the manual counter. Have to show passport. Ticketing counter is located beside the tourist centre.

Free entry for kids 6 years old and below or less than 1.2m tall.
Discounted tickets for seniors above 60.

A lot of steep steps to climb.
Wear sports shoes, bring sunblock and mosquito repellent.

The volcano crater is not hard to reach. Just walk all the way up.
But to go to the bottom of the forested crater - is the challenge.

There is also a mini museum about this place to visit with cooling fan.
There are drink stalls available along the way.

There is also a kids outdoor playground but the price is rather expensive. Hence we skipped and decided to bring our kids to the mall for cooler playing areas instead.

This place is like Marvelous, I never thought that I can visit this types of historical place where the nature and the history hug each other. If you went to hainan I suggest you to visit al least once at this place, you will  learn and watch different things that you never knew it. I will go there again if I went to hainan next time.

went to 火山口地质公园volcano crater geopark today on5.1.2024

msg the didi 师傅to pick us up 9am

journey rmb60

we got the senior discount rmb27pax entry

quite interesting place

we went up to the crater mouth..it’s overgrown with vegetation

took about 2hrs+

after that we flagged a cab to 阿浪for lunch also rmb60

Direct bus from Evergreen Park Bus Stop. Cost RMB15 to get here by bus.

Fresh air and magnificent view. Able to see Haikou City from the top. This crater has erupted 8000 years ago and now it has grown vegetation all around. This geopark is maintained well and proper, just that many Chinese tourist being loud and inconsiderate towards nature and spit all around.

Many chairs available for resting if tired mid hike. Learnt alot about craters and volcanoes here. Highly recommended place to visit if you are in Haikou.

This is an amazing volcanic cluster located in Haikou, Hainan Province in China. The landscape is quite beautiful; with thick, rich, and bright green plants all over the area -- much more like a typical rain-forest. This place reminded me of the Amazon rain-forest, which I saw on Anaconda the movie :-)

data.formatted_address: 3 Gong Yuan Lu, Long Hua Qu, Hai Kou Shi, Hai Nan Sheng, China, 570102
data.name: People's Park

reviews.text: I liked this park for morning walks. There were many groups of people practicing dancing, singing or other arts. There are a few ping-pong tables around, so don’t forget you racquet. There is also a basketball court.
Recreation...

It's a beautiful park. However, it seemed like it was not being utilized by citizens or tourists.
The lakes (West Lake, East Lake) are under construction. I sometimes saw elderly people exercising in various places in the park.
There was a tree with very long branches, which was interesting.
Comfortable and clean with a combination of sophisticated infrastructure technology.
The best time is in the evening. Staying until night gives you a different flavor.
